    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardController

        public BoardController()
        Initializes a new Board Controller. This is used for controlling the representation of the game of the frame. It handles pieces that are displayed on the screen.
        See Also:
        MoveController

    • Method Detail

      • getComponents

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Component> getComponents()
        Gets an arrayList of all the current components (pieces) currently on the board.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Components
        See Also:
        Component

      • updatePieces

        public static void updatePieces()
        Updates the board's components to have the correct location as defined by the pieces in the PiecesArray model class which handles all piece data.

      • addPieces

        public static void addPieces()
        Resets the board by removing all components and re-adding components to the display panel.

      • movePiece

        public static void movePiece(Piece piece,
                             java.awt.Point location)
        Moves a piece from one location to another. If the piece trying to be moved is not of the same colour as the player turn, it will not allow the move. Will pass the move information to the PiecesArray model for further move handling.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to be moved
        location - The location of the move as defined by the piece's move hint.

      • inverseColour

        public static void inverseColour()
        Switches the current player to move to the other.
